instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_3GH: What is PPBUS_3GH? PPBUS_3GH is a typo of PPBUS_G3H. If you see someone type PPBUS_3GH assume they meant to type PPBUS_G3H.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power
threads.message:
Hi there
on the <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> the PP3V42 is present 3.4V the <SIGNAL>PPBUS_3GH</SIGNAL> is 1.3 v.
i found there short to the ground ,by removing the <CAPACITOR>C7340</CAPACITOR> <CAPACITOR>C7341</CAPACITOR>, the short is gone , but as soon i replaced them few times now , the short is back. these 2 capas boiling hot , what could causing the short now ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power
threads.message:
<TRANSISTOR>Q7330</TRANSISTOR> shorted D-S on high side (1-6)???
Applying <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> on 2V caps is not a good idea...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power
threads.message: removed <TRANSISTOR>Q7330</TRANSISTOR> replaced it. now no short to any <CAPACITOR>C7340</CAPACITOR> <CAPACITOR>C7341</CAPACITOR> BUT still no power and <TRANSISTOR>Q7330</TRANSISTOR> is very hot not shorted , can not find short !! any clue
